content.brief: Only provide personal information (like a credit card when shopping online) when the connection to the website is encrypted, or else your interaction with that website can be spied on or even hijacked. You can verify a website is encrypted by looking for "https" before the website address, which depending on your browser can be complemented by a lock symbol or green bar. Avoid using unencrypted websites when on public wireless hotspots, as they are particularly vulnerable to the snooping of hackers.
